Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: BoraAnkara_Turkey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and enough space to move in the room. The area is quite silence and near to the Nou camp stadium but not in the down town . There is a direct subway available to the city center La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmaandSteve
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel on several occasions and it is very clean and well presented with friendly and approachable staff. Good facilities in a nice area of the city, close to the Nou camp which my husband loves. There are a selection of good restaurants and cafes close by and the metro is a short walk which is cheap and easy to use. Our only issue on our last visit was that the room we had was like a sauna and there was no air conditioning working so we did not sleep well at all, mainly due to the lack of air circulating, even with the window open! We did ask but were told it was not hot enough for the air con to be switched on!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Camp Nou”
Reviews.Author: Gary T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I can't really fault the hotel, it was good value for money, the rooms were clean, the staff polite and most importantly for me, it was close to Camp Nou. It is also a 5 minute walk from the Metro and you can be in Ramblas in about 15 20 minutes from here. There are a small number of restaurants and bars nearby including a Starbucks, which may be better value than teh restaurant, (although we did not look at the price or menu at the hotel, we found out that breakfast was 16Euro, which seems a little bit steep). There is also free WiFi available at the hotel. My only complaint was that unfortunately we stayed during the coldest spell in Barcelona in years, (not teh hotels fault :) ) there was no duvet, only sheets on the beds and there was only one blanket available between the two beds in the room, although I'm sure that reception would have provided us with another had we asked. There is also not much of a view from the windows, but if you want views, go outside!! I have stayed at a number of hotels close to the Camp Nou but I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ideal for the nou camp.”
Reviews.Author: jayalfie
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed at this hotel and it was great value. Ideal for the nou camp and only a 5 min walk to the tube station where you can go anywhere for 2 Euro. The staff were great everywhere really clean overal an excellent place to stay and will be going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gerdunn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel after watching a late night match at the Camp Nou. So, at five minutes walk from the stadium the location was excellent. It is also very easy to get into the city as there is a metro station very close by. The staff were very friendly at efficient and not at all put out by the late arrival. The decor is very modern and the breakfast was excellent. My only gripe was that the lighting in the room was quite dark and one of the reading lights was not working. I would be happy to recommend this hotel for any city break to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “above average business hotel, slow wifi”
Reviews.Author: MochaChoca
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in Septermber 2012. The hotel was above average, though has room for improvement. This is definitely a business hotel, situated near the university and Palau de Congresso away from the main tourist areas. The nearest train station is an 8 minute walk away, and there are a few cafes nearby for a quick meal. The department store El Corte Ingles is close by, but the hotel isn't close to any other shops. I was lucky that I had a south facing room with some sunlight (most of the rooms don't have natural light). The room was modern and well furnished, though lighting could have been better. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large, with a well stocked supply of toiletries. I found it hypocritical that there were signs warning guests to save water, while the shower head was massive - the most water wasting shower I've ever experienced in a hotel. If the hotel is serious serious about saving water, perhaps they should change their shower-heads? Staff was friendly enough, though could have been a bit more helpful. It often took a while to find the barista at the hotel bar to get a quick coffee. I didn't eat breakfast at the hotel so can't comment on the food. As a 4* hotel, it would be nice if there was a kettle in the room for coffee. One thing that I found particularly frustrating was the slow wifi, especially in the room. This is especially frustrating for a business traveller. If the wifi is slow, at least offer a premium upgrade so that people can use skype. As I couldn't use skype I was forced to use the hotel phone to make a very expensive call home.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: joebecquets
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Catalonia Rigoletto in September 2011 in room 105. The Catalonia Rigoletto is off the tourist beaten path in Barcelona but conveniently situated at an easy 10 minutes walk from two metro stations. If you want an hotel in the midst of Barcelona's night life, this is not an address for you. If you want a good value for the money, within walking distance of the Metro, of a large chain store (Corte Ingles, a cross between Neiman Marcus, Saks with a touch of Harrod's) and some restaurants, this could represent a good base to stay in Barcelona. A good way to describe the Catalonia Rigoletto is to classify it as a boutique hotel. The room we had was impeccable in term of cleanliness and amenities, obviously recently decorated. The comfort was excellent. (It was a smoking room. We forgot to specify we prefer non smoking in our online reservation...) The view however was non existent unless you appreciate the relative calm of... a wall (this could be specific to our room). We had all our breakfasts with the hotel. The breakfast is served as a buffet that can, in all likelihood, satisfy the taste of Europeans as well as North-Americans'. We didn't had lunches or dinners at the hotel. So I can't comment. The service was efficient and professional. However, we would have appreciated a smile from time to time. All in all, a good value for the money as long as you are looking for the type of location the hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Good Location, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travellove91
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Catalonia Rigoletto ( 16th-19th September). We had a late flight and arrived at the hotel at around 11.30 at night, when we got there we were extremely annoyed because the hotel had been over booked and there wasnt a room for us for that night. However, the staff (Marc at reception) were very helpful and very sorry about the situation. They booked us in at another hotel free of charge and paid for the taxi there and paid for the taxi in the morning back to Catalonia Rigoletto. When we did check in we had an amazing room, with a huge bed, a separate living room area and a very very nice bathroom. The bathroom was spacious with a shower and a bath. We had two tvs in the room (only one english channel). We didnt have a south facing room so the view was poor and there was barely any sunlight, but to be honest we didnt spend much time in the hotel so this didnt bother us! The location is good, the Metro station (Maria Christina) is about 5 minutes walk from the hotel and it takes about 15 minutes to get to Las Ramblas and you can walk to the beach from there. Hotel staff were very helpful if ever we had any questions, rooms were clean and the rest of the hotel was clean. We didnt eat at the hotel so I cant comment on that! Also, the air conditioning in the room was fairly noisy and stopped working at times.

Reviews.Title: “WE DID NOT LOVE IT AND WE 'LL NEVER BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: MARINA M
Reviews.Content: Our room has no view and no sunlight. Was overlooking the offices opposite. We've been given a smoking room (without been asked if we smoke or not) that smell badly. Decoration of the room is modern and bathroom was spacious. Breakfast room is small for hotel residents so we had to eat in terms!!! We've been asked to eat between 8:00-8:45! Poor breakfast, shortage in some items, not exactly polite personnel

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Katerety
Reviews.Content: Good quality for the price. Very quiet area, but near to metro station. Hotel staff was really helpful and kind to us. The only disadvantage of our room was the fact that it wasn't south facing, and there was a other building opposite so we didn't have much natural light inside. I think I would come back there anyway, but before making reservation ask for sunny room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a little far from the action”
Reviews.Author: jeanette1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and the room is lovely. The bathroom is large and the restaurant breakfast is very good. The front facade of the hotel is very deceiving, as it looks very run down, however the inside is a pleasant surprise. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Lobo177
Reviews.Content: Myself , My Wife and two friends stayed in this hotel for one night prior to embarking on a one week cruise of the Mediteranian. The hotel is in a nice qiuet street but still central to all that Barcelona has to offer. In our case it was just a short taxi ride to the docks for our ship. The rooms were very nice . Qiiet and clean and very modern ( too much so for us ,as we took some time to figure out the shower controlls!! ) We did not partake of breakfast as it seemed a little pricey at €14 each for a buttet and there are lots of eateries in the vicinity. All in all though we would recomend this hotel and last but not least the starff were very polite and friendly , which is most improtant when you are away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ddrCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 15 km (30 Euro) taxi ride from the airport and it is set in a quiet street away from downtown. The hotel is near to two stops on the Barcelona Bus Turistic (recommend) bus tour and one stop on the Barcelona City Tour. The room was excellent, great bed, large, and the bathroom was clean and also big. Our friends had a room that has a separate living area and a tub and separate shower in the bathroom. The breakfast was not included in our room rate (room was about 100 euro/night) so we did not have the breakfast because it was an additional 16 euro/person/day. Up the street there was a little bakery and we ate there. The hotel also had the best air conditioning as it was very cold at night...better than being hot trying to sleep! Great hotel - definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: jamie_sommers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights here after leaving a horrid hovel of a hotel which was "right in the middle of the action". For us, it was more than worth the time on the metro to have the peace and quiet and high quality room at the Catalonia Rigoletto. Our room was reasonably sized for Europe, and had nice clean modern styling. It had a nice flat screen TV with decent cable selections, and a FANTASTIC bathroom and shower. The showerhead was one of those overhead "rain" types which was luxurious. It was amazingly quiet at night. I had used earplugs at every other hotel on our trip, but didn't even need them there. The staff was outstanding. They went out of their way to make sure that we could watch the women's world cup final. We asked the day before if it would be showing on our cable system, and then they arranged for us to watch it with some of our friends in the cafe downstairs, and brought us drinks and chips and nuts. The staff kept coming out to check on the score and help us cheer (we really liked the guy whose name we can't remember, but who had studied in Florida and spoke flawless English -- he was helpful and super friendly). We also really liked Danni and the bartender and well, everybody we dealt with there. One big downside was that our room was way too hot. It was July, and humid out, and though our room had "air conditioning", we had it set on the coldest setting and I was still sweating. I'm pretty sure it was only a fan. We asked the staff to look into it, but it really never improved. Also, the breakfast was not included and was overpriced at 13 Euros (we were easily able to find cafe's nearby with cafe con leche and a croissant for 5 Euros or so.) Another bonus was the easy access to the metro station, though we were on a relatively quiet side street. Also, at the end of the street is a tunnel freeway entrance that made the trip to the airport quick and relatively cheap by cab. We will recommend this hotel to friends who are visiting Barcelona later this year, and we would certainly stay there again ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “AN excellent hotel. We will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: PG-1313
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very quiet and with the sleeping shades drawn, you needed a wake up call or you could sleep the entire morning. The breakfast was excellent. The rooms were comfortable adn the shower was super. By far the best element of the hotel was its staff from the desk slerks to the chamber maids - all were very friendly and could speak English. Of particular note, I need to commend Alvaro Daroca and Victor for their assistance with every question we had. They are the best!!!. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: celena98
Reviews.Content: For those of us who love the hustle and bustle of Barcelona during the day and evening but want peace, quiet, and comfort for the sleeping and "off" hours, the Catalonia Rigoletto is the place to be. Don't be dismayed when you pull up to the unassuming door. Once inside, you will be greeted by an exceptionally friendly and efficient staff who speak excellent English. The hotel is clean, pleasant, and the rooms were somewhat small but plenty of room for a tourist's needs. Beds very comfortable, excellent showers and amply sized bathrooms, and I have never stayed in such a quiet hotel. The room darkening shades really helped too. Daily, excellent maid service. Full breakfast included. Staying at the Rigoletto made the week in Barcelona a complete pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good location and OK service”
Reviews.Author: carcam36
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near Ave. Diagonal, a major artery in Barcelona, but somewhat away from where the action is in this city. The room is excellent, yet a little small. The bathroom is 5 stars, and the price is fantastic for Barcelona, less than EUR100. At the reception things get a little complicated, and whoever arrives by car will feel it difficult to bring the luggage to the hotel, as it is impossible to reach the lobby with the car. The underground garage is very expensive and the connection with the hotel is not always available, so be prepared. In spite of this, I still enjoyed it, since the room/bathroom was so good.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for the Camp Nou!!”
Reviews.Author: JGSF5
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and modern hotel near the Camp Nou. Excellent staff and a superb breakfast!! ideally located near the metro for travelling around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Hotel while tour trip”
Reviews.Author: Julia_Pech
Reviews.Content: Usually in tour group trips there are cheap and not special hotels. But this one was really perfect. I was impressed by the design inside. Beds were ideal for sleeping and bathroom was really grate. For rest after long excursions day it was amazing. Location is wuite good, near Diagonal street, also shopping centres are not far. We were by tour bus, but I m sure there is possibility to use public transport. From outside buitlding is not attarctive, (I guess it is old) but inside it is wonderful. And price was good also

Reviews.Title: “Wifi not working properly”
Reviews.Author: mianth0ny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in principle fine and offers ok value for money. However, should you need the internet it is not a good place to stay as the connection is highly unstable and making phone calls over skype not really possible as you get interrupted frequently. I am a frequent business traveller and only book hotels where WiFi is available at no charge. This is also why I booked this hotel but was very disappointed as their connection is not sufficient to actually conduct work

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janakii
Reviews.Content: Kerb-side appeal definitely leaves much to be desired, but this hotel is very close to the metro (Maria Christina), and a number of restaurants nearby. Check in was fairly quick, room was good. Clean and well sized. However the view was of a wall, and the room was fairly dark. Pros -Internet connectivity was good, bed comfortable, room quiet, bathroom nice, mini-safe, tv, heating/ac all fine. Location was very good for the offices i needed to attend, but not so great for tourists- but less than 30 mins away by metro to the tourist sights/sites.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not special”
Reviews.Author: arnoldthecat
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in a large part because of the outstanding reviews that it had recieved on TripAdvisor. The hotel is clean, friendly and quiet. The rooms are spacious and well equipped. The location is quite remote from the centre and the hotel is in the midst of a hospital complex so there are a few bars close by but it's not exactly bustling. Having stayed in Barcelona twice before this year I cannot understand why this hotel is rated so far above either of the hotels we had visited previously -the Market Hotel or the Hotel Praktika, both of which are considerably closer to the centre and substantially more charming and quaint. If you are looking for a convention type hotel or need to be in this part of town (as we did) then it's a very good choice but for a long weekend of sightseeing there are better alternatives

Reviews.Title: “Superlative value for money and excelent service”
Reviews.Author: Xaviermartin
Reviews.Content: I travel pretty often to Barcelona and I know well other hotels in the city. I found this one outstanding in terms of confort, service and value for the money. The restaurant also deserves a try

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: JosieGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Recently I went to Spain for the first time and stayed at the Catalonia Rigoletto. This is a very nice hotel. It is located near a metro station, the rooms were clean and comfortable and rates were reasonable. The main purpose of this review is to thank the staff, especially Victor and Dani on reception who really helped us. They were very professional and friendly. They spoke excellent English too. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robin1250
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd read the reviews more closely so that I would not have been dismayed when our taxi pulled up in front of the hotel. I was a little concerned by the lack of curb appeal but, as others have written, as soon as we entered the lobby, I knew we'd be okay. The front desk staff was efficient, our room was spacious, nicely decorated and very quiet and the bathroom was great (no tub but an enormous, very nice shower). The location of the hotel is great - a short walk to the metro and a straight shot to the heart of the tourist action. There are several restaurants and little cafes in the neighborhood and we had a light dinner in the hotel restaurant one night and breakfast there the morning we were checking out. Both meals were good. I definitely recommend The Catalonia Rigoletto - nice place, great, quiet location - an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “A port in the storm on the day of Spain's general strike”
Reviews.Author: jerilynch
Reviews.Content: 29/9/10- Day of Spain's general strike and the day we are scheduled to fly into Madrid. NOT. All flights cancelled. Eventually we were able to get into Barcelona after a 5 hour wait in Heathrow. During our incarceration, we went online and found hotel Catalonia Rigoletto, From the website, it looked perfect, I tried to book. At first, it showed full, I went back on 2 minutes later and, bingo, was able to book. Later, we learned that the hotel was full all day with a tiny window when a cancellation came in. We so lucked out. When we arrived, we weren't sure at first at the hotel doesn't really have any curb appeal. Once inside, however, we were in heaven. Great rooms, great staff. Wonderful quiet neighborhood. A welcome reward after a very trying and tiring day. Plus we found a great restaurant nearby, La Botiga - amazing flat bread with tomato!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel , Clean , good sized rooms with very helpful staff .”
Reviews.Author: MickV1967
Reviews.Content: Not a Great Hotel to look at from the outside, but is suprisingly good on the inside . The Staff are very helpful and the rooms are a good size and very clean . A few decent places to eat nearby and easy Metro connections close by also . Did not dissappoint and we will be going again very soon . Thoroughly deserves its rating! Only Negative point ....Pillows were too hard ! But hey you can't have ot all.

Reviews.Title: “Great cost benefit”
Reviews.Author: eehotel
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly hotel (especial praises for Dani at front desk), with VERY comfortable and large room, free internet, great breakfast, well located and if you are too pooped to go out the food is also very very nice. Although not at the old town, it takes a less than five minutes walk to the subway and another 10min to be at old Barcelona, Barceloneta, or wherever you may want to go. Greatly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Haz19
Reviews.Content: I always read these reviews so have finally decided to add one myself. Catalonia Rigoletto is possibly the best hotel I have ever stayed in! We didn't originally organise to go to this hotel but we put there because of a flood at another Catalonia hotel. The hotel is in the business district of Barcelona which means that it was really quiet in the nights, the room was beautiful and the staff were really polite (their English was really good). Even though the hotel is in the business district the metro station was just around the corner, the metro line being the green line went straight to Las Ramblas (5-10 mins max). Really safe area, and the room got cleaned every day. Would definitely go to the Rigoletto again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Great Sleeping”
Reviews.Author: nzpilot
Reviews.Content: No, it's not on Las Ramblas, but it is easy to get to the tourist part of town. It is only 2 blocks from a Metro and 3 blocks from a hop-on/hop-off bus stop. When we are in our hotel, we want to sleep, and this place excelled in providing a modern, clean room with the biggest and best shower we have ever had in Europe. We stayed here at the end of a cruise because other "1st choices" were not available, BUT this is our new 1st choice. The rooms have black out curtains for those who need to sleep in the day. We arrived at 9am and immediately were offered a room. The staff thought we had just flown in over night and was very sensitive to getting us in a room. The hotel breakfast looked typical and NOT a great value since it was not included in our rate (174E total for 2 nights through booking.com). BUT local cafes are a stone throw from the door. Having been on a 2 week cruise, we had a ton of laundry that we did not want to pay hotel prices for. The desk clerk staff was quite understanding (also spoke excellent English), found a local wash n' fold within an 8 min walk, and printed out a map of how to get there off the internet. A large taxi van from the cruise port to the hotel was easily available on the pier for 35 euros for our party of 4 and 6 bags. The desk arranged a taxi to the airport on departure for about the same price. This hotel is adjacent to the university and perfect for someone attending a football event. It is only 2 yrs old, so the rooms are great and a substantial value for money. The free wireless internet was an added bonus. Desk was happy to print out our boarding our airline boarding passes for free asking me to email them a pdf. Bottomline: we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly”
Reviews.Author: VasfIsmail
Reviews.Content: It's small. Yes. But very accurate, clean and new hotel with a friendly stuff. I've enjoyed staying there. If you prefer clean and comfort hotel, Catalonia Rigoletto is for you. I'm traveling a lot. It's within my top 3.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent in Every Respect”
Reviews.Author: elfina
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Barcelona having been caught up in the Volcanic ash flight cancellations. We stayed here for 2 nights as we could not get further nights at our origional hotel, I have to say that I was a bit worried having read a tripadviser review saying that it was horrible but as I was so stressed out by not knowing if we would ever get home I decided to give it a go. I can honestly say that I am completely baffled as to why it should have received a bad review. On arriving at the hotel the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, they offered to take our case to the room and check in was seamless and quick. The room was beautiful, extremely modern and clean. We had booked a standard room with shower. The bed was huge and very comfortable, a comfortable chair and table were provided. The lighting was excellent and varied - no problem being able to see to read. A minibar/fridge and free electronic safe were provided and the cupboard space was ample. The room was very quiet both day and night due to thesecondary glazing. Another lovely feature was the bathroom which was all dark marble and contained a 2 headed power shower. The cubicle was so big that you could have had a party of people in there all at once if you were that way inclined! The metro which is just round the corner is Maria cristiana. It is on a main line three stops from the main rail station and goes direct to all the tourist stops which are all in the same zone. The area of this hotel itself is lovely - quite modern as it is in the business and University section, within an easy walk there are three must sees; the Gaudi gates, a serene Monastry with some of the largest Medieval cloisters in Europe and the Royal Palace which houses 3 excellent museums all for just 5 euros. There is also a large shopping centre nearby. As we were stuck due to the cancelled flights with very little money we decided to eat at the hotel so that we could put it on the room bill. The food was exceptional - some of the best I have had and very good value at 12 euros for 3 courses and & 7 euros for a bottle of very decent house wine. The restaurant was modern, spotless and on 2 different levels with big windows downstairs. It was very popular and as so well used. The day I left I had to pack really quickly as my husband had gone ahead to the airport and managed to get us on an earlier flight which was leaving in 2 hours giving me just an hour to get to the airport. I was in a terrible panic but the Manager and 2 of his reception staff were absolutely brilliant, they got me a taxi within 2 minutes, carried my bag to it and even got my mobile phone working again which had jammed!!! I don't think I'll be back to Barcelona in the near future but if I am I would definately stay at rhis lovely hotel no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: TAadvisor
Reviews.Content: I booked the Catalonia Rigoletto after reading the great reviews on trip advisor and after being impressed at its high rating and low rates per night. When I drove up, I knew that I had been mislead. I wish I had taken a picture to caution others about what they are getting into.The neighborhood is very far away from all sights in barcelona, in a very concrete area. There was no one to help with my bags. When we arrived there was one sweaty clerk behind the desk who informed us the closest restaurant besides theirs which was very unappetizing, was 2 subway stops away. The hotel "restaurant" was an all white room with no windows and a few tables and didnt look like a legitimate restaurant, or anywhere I would like to eat. The hotel room was not cleaned properly as there was a thick layer of dust on everything and the shower smelled strongly of mildew. Additionally, we rarely saw any other guests in the hotel, it was a very eerie feeling to be walking down a new looking but dusty hallway, that was dark (motion sensor lights) and our footsteps were literally echoing. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone. I left after one night, and my trip looked up as soon as I left the hotel, which ended up costing me, since I was unable to be reimbursed for the money I had wasted at catalonia rigoletto.

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Rigoletto
